definition: to poison/fig. to spread vicious rumors
to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)

sentences.english: Someone tried to poison the water supply.
sentences.chinese: 有人企图在供水系统里放毒。

sentences.english: They poison other fish and digest them while the fish are alive.
sentences.chinese: 它们对其他鱼放毒，然后将这些鱼活活消化。

sentences.english: It was in the lower field next day,poisoning.
sentences.chinese: 次日在较低的田里放毒。

definition: to put poison in sth/to poison
to harm sb/to inflict suffering/to victimize/pernicious
to prescribe medicine/to poison/to slip a drug (into sb's drink etc)
to cure ills with poison (TCM)/to fight evil with evil/set a thief to catch a thief/to fight fire with fire
to knock sb out with a drug/to render sb unconscious
to crowdsource information about sb or sth (abbr. for 人肉搜索[ren2 rou4 sou1 suo3])/human (used attributively, as in 人肉盾牌[ren2 rou4 dun4 pai2], human shield)
